data.text: To experiment rashly; busy one's self unwisely or officiously; meddle: usually followed by with in this and the other senses.
To interfere, as for the purpose of alteration; make objectionable or unauthorized changes (in): as, to <internalXref urlencoded="tamper%20with">tamper with</internalXref> a will or other document.
To use secret or underhand measures; exert unfair or corrupt influence; especially, to use improper persuasions, solicitations, bribery, etc.
One who tamps, or prepares for blasting by stopping the hole in which the charge is placed.
An instrument used in tamping; a tamping-bar or tamping-iron.
One who tamps; specifically, one who prepares for blasting, by filling the hole in which the charge is placed.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: An instrument used in tamping; a tamping iron.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: To meddle; to be busy; to try little experiments.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: To meddle so as to alter, injure, or vitiate a thing.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: To deal unfairly; to practice secretly; to use bribery.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.
